articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Palestinian militant group Hamas will likely replace Yahya Sinwar with a new political leader based outside Gaza while his brother - Mohammad Sinwar - is expected to assume a bigger role directing the war against Israel in the territory, experts say.
articles.title: Hamas likely to name new leader from outside Gaza after Sinwar's death

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump are barreling through the battleground state of Michigan on Friday, where opinion polls show the U.S. presidential candidates are essentially tied just 18 days before the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Harris, Trump barnstorm in Michigan, where polls are tied

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Friday it sent another army unit to support its forces operating in Jabalia, the largest of Gaza's eight historic refugee camps, where residents said tanks blew up roads and houses as they thrust further into the territory.
articles.title: Israel sends more troops into north Gaza, deepens raid

articles.author: Dave Sherwood, Marianna Parraga
articles.description: Cuba's national electrical grid shut down on Friday after one of the island's major power plants failed, Cuba's energy ministry said, plunging the entire country into a blackout.
articles.title: Cuba's power grid fails, plunging country into darkness

articles.author: Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Gunmen sprayed with bullets the office building and several cars of respected Sinaloan media outlet El Debate on Friday, the news organization said, amid a bloody war between the two biggest factions of the Sinaloa Cartel.
articles.title: Gunmen attack Sinaloan media outlet amid intra-cartel war

articles.author: Rachael Levy, Alexandra Ulmer
articles.description: The political action committee funded by billionaire Elon Musk to help re-elect former U.S. President Donald Trump is struggling in some swing states to meet doorknocking goals and is investigating claims that some canvassers lied about the number of voters they have contacted, according to people involved in the group's efforts.
articles.title: Exclusive: Pro-Trump group funded by Musk struggles with outreach targets, inflation of doorknocking figures

articles.author: Luis Jaime Acosta
articles.description: Colombian land dedicated to the cultivation of coca leaves, a raw ingredient for cocaine, jumped 10% last year to reach the largest area in over two decades, a report by the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) found on Friday.
articles.title: Colombian coca leaf farming hit two-decade high in 2023, UN says

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Tom Perry, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli leaders are now seeking to lock in strategic gains and reshape the regional landscape in its favour.
articles.title: After Sinwar's death, Israel aims to lock in strategic gains before US election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden is expected to visit the Amazon rainforest and meet Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva before they attend the G20 summit in Rio de Janeiro in November, sources familiar with the negotiations told Reuters.
articles.title: Biden visit to Amazon rainforest planned in November, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine each swapped 95 prisoners of war on Friday in an agreement completed with the United Arab Emirates acting as mediator, the Russian Defence Ministry said.
articles.title: Russia, Ukraine each swap 95 prisoners of war, Russian Defence Ministry says
